global_flags.description: the  explicit make program to be used by CMake when configuring and building the project. Only applicable for Make and Ninja based generators.
the  build  tool).   Note  that  if  this  is  specified,  the

The option can be given multiple times with different targets, in  which  case  each  target  is built in turn.  A clean will be done before building each target unless the --build-noclean option is given.
program  if  the  test  should  fail.   This  option  can  also  be  enabled  by  setting  the CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE environment variable
All arguments following this keyword will  be  assumed  to  be part of the test command line, so it must be the last option given.
the directory in which to look for tests, typically a CMake project build directory. If not specified, the current directory is used.
The output is printed to a named <file> if given.

flags.description: = Configure, build and run a test.
= A sample executable to use to determine the configuration
= Specify the directory for the executable.
= Specify the generator to use.
= Specify the generator-specific platform.
= Specify the generator-specific toolset.
= Specify the make program to use.
= Skip the make clean step.
= Run the build without running cmake first.
= Add extra options to the build step.
= Specify the name of the project to build.
= Specify directory to run programs from.
= Specify a specific target to build.
= Run CMake twice
= Displaying more verbose internals of CTest.
= Enable more verbose output from tests.
= Run child CTest instances as new processes
= Specify what build group on the dashboard you'd like to submit results to.
= Print help for one keyword and exit.
= Print cmake-commands manual and exit.
= Print all help manuals and exit.
= List help manuals available and exit.
= List modules with help available and exit.
= Print cmake-modules manual and exit.
= Print cmake-policies manual and exit.
= List policies with help available and exit.
= Print cmake-properties manual and exit.
= Print cmake-variables manual and exit.
= Submit using HTTP 1.0.
= List available test presets.
= Set the max width for a test name to output
= Do not compress test output when submitting.
= Disable timing summary information for labels.
= Disable timing summary information for subprojects.
= Regard no tests found either as 'error' or 'ignore' it.
= Output test results to JUnit XML file.
= Output anything outputted by the test program if the test should fail.
= Overwrite CTest configuration option.
= Print all available test labels.
= Enable short progress output from tests.
= Make ctest quiet.
= Allow each test to run up to <n> times in order to pass
= Run only the tests that failed previously
= Set the resource spec file to use.
= Use a random order for scheduling tests
= Disable actual execution of tests. The optional 'format' defines the format of the test information and can be 'human' for the current text format or 'json-v1' for json format. Defaults to 'human'.
= Stop running the tests after one has failed.
= Set a time at which all tests should stop running.
= Submit individual dashboard tests with specific index
= The test to run with the --build-and-test option.
= Specify the directory in which to look for tests.
= CPU load threshold for starting new parallel tests.
= The time limit in seconds, internal use only.
= Set the default test timeout.
= Nightly or experimental starts with next day tag.
= Take the Union of -I and -R
= Enable verbose output from tests.
= Define a variable for script mode
= Enable failover.
With multiple -L, run tests where each regular expression matches at least one label.
With multiple -LE, exclude tests where each regular expression matches at least one label.
